reference: Volume Two, Issue Eleven, Phile #1 of 12
title: Index to Phrack Eleven
historical_context: This article serves as an index for the eleventh issue of Phrack, a significant hacking zine from the 1980s that contributed to the hacker culture and knowledge sharing.
target_audience: Hackers, security researchers, and enthusiasts of hacker culture.
short_summary: This article provides a comprehensive index of the articles featured in Phrack Issue Eleven, summarizing the topics covered and the authors involved.
summary:
The 'Index to Phrack Eleven' serves as a guide to the contents of the eleventh issue of Phrack Inc., detailing the various articles and their respective authors. Taran King, the author of the index, notes the challenges faced in compiling this issue, including difficulties in reaching contributors. Despite these challenges, the index highlights a diverse range of topics that reflect the interests and concerns of the hacking community at the time.

The articles featured in this issue include discussions on hacking voice mail systems, data encryption, and telephone signaling methods, among others. Each entry in the index provides a brief overview of the content, allowing readers to quickly identify articles of interest. This index not only serves as a practical tool for navigating the issue but also encapsulates the spirit of collaboration and knowledge sharing that characterized the early days of hacker culture.
